intro: Strychnos mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Amazonian devil's backbone, is a woody shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It is notable for containing toxic alkaloids, similar to those found in other members of the genus Strychnos. Due to its habitat and chemical composition, it plays a significant role in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
